content:
There are different types of nanomaterials and their applications are as follows:

1. Nanoparticles- They are tiny particles with a size range of 1-100 nanometers. These are used in drug delivery, cosmetics, electronics, and optics.

2. Nanotubes- These are cylindrical structures made up of carbon atoms. They are used in nanoelectronics, batteries, and fuel cells.

3. Nanowires- These are thin wires with a diameter of a few nanometers. These are used in nanoelectronics, energy storage devices, and sensors.

4. Quantum Dots- These are tiny semiconductor particles with a size range of 2-10 nanometers. These are used in biological imaging, displays, and lighting.

5. Carbon Nanotubes- These are tubular structures made of carbon atoms. These are used in nanoelectronics, composites, and sensors.

6. Graphene- These are flat sheets of single-layer carbon atoms arranged in a hexagonal lattice. These are used in sensors, batteries, and energy storage devices.

7. Nanoceramics- These are ceramics with a grain size of a few nanometers. These are used in coatings, catalysts, and biomedical implants.

8. Dendrimers- These are highly branched molecules with a size range of 1-20 nanometers. These are used in drug delivery, catalysts, and biomedical imaging.

9. Nanoporous Materials- These are materials with tiny pores in their structure. These are used in catalysis, gas separation, and water purification.
